body: ok, I guess this means we need to update the addin in the apps dashboard. but this should not be any problem
Ok- happy to leave this open for now if it will cause issues
alright; I am deep deep deep in mammoth to get the ooxml conversion working
Anything I can help with? Right now I'm just adding improvements to the view

that's great! well, turns out that `ooxml` is like unzipped and merged `docx` format - so it is not really working out of the box. I am trying to put all components together that mammoth can also interpret ooxml files
but it's not working yet, it's very tricky
probably a reason why they don't support HTML export on word online, because there is no ooxml.js yet
If it looks like a dead-end I guess we could look at only supporting Word offline for now? Just makes it tricky to test...
for word offline i cannot really contribute. but we could check if the coercion type `html` is available, and then use it for conversion.

I'm gonna have to call it a night. I haven't done much more to the app other than making the views a little nicer, but I have added some tests and CI integration. Can look at this in the morning and try and get the conversion sorted
man, you have been on fire - thanks for the great work. I am still trying to add ooxml support :(
Easy to get lots done when I'm the one doing the easy stuff! That OOXML stuff looks like a PITA...

I was hacking like crazy last night on mammoth, but somehow it didn't work. It seems that the ooxml file that is returned by the Office API is not containing everything (for example I couldn't find the content of the file in ooxml). I included `to-markdown` so we can still use html conversion for the desktop apps.
Ahh, and at one point our office online plugin was not working anymore - where I didn't change anything; and it is still not working.

Ah ok, no worries, good effort though! I'm installing Office locally now, so as everything else _should_ work (not sure why the plugin doesn't right now) we can just use my laptop to finish it off this morning if you want?

I might need some help getting setup with the add-in and using it with Office.

What time do you want to meet up later?
That would be great. I will leave my hotel and go to the hack room, maybe we can meet there before the conference starts
In that case.... I will get ready now. May not get there much before 9 though.
no worries. thanks

Cool, if you do want to look at it before using my laptop, I guess we'll need to:
- Add `to-markdown` using Bower / NPM
- Modify `getContent` and `getContentBackend` to use HTML instead of OOXML
- Modify `markdownConverter` to call `getContent.getDocumentAsHtml()` rather than `getContent.getDocumentAsOoxml()`
Also if you want to organise meeting up, might be easier to just text me. My number's on http://tomseldon.co.uk/
hackspace is not opened, I am on the very end close to the unconf room

Ok, just leaving my hotel now

Works on desktop for Windows, with known comment issue (#33).
Blocked by #76

Closing as seems to be complete. Unable to confirm due to #76 but every provider seems tested.

Only area of confirm would be better testing of the markdown service (without testing the third-party conversion library).
